intro: Sedum piaxtlaense, commonly known as the Piaxtla sedum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to Mexico, specifically the state of Hidalgo, where it grows in rocky and arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves that help it store water, adapting to its harsh habitat. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Sedum piaxtlaense is a low-growing plant that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
